materials.raw_text: B: 20 g, Co: 15 g, Tc: 5 g, W: 30 g

sourcing.instructions: B: Boron powder from chemical supply stores. Co: Cobalt powder from metal suppliers. Tc: Technetium powder from nuclear material suppliers (ensure proper licensing). W: Tungsten powder from specialty metal suppliers.
steps: B: Boron powder from chemical supply stores. Co: Cobalt powder from metal suppliers. Tc: Technetium powder from nuclear material suppliers (ensure proper licensing). W: Tungsten powder from specialty metal suppliers.

1. Measure 20 g of boron powder and place in a clean mixing container. 2. Add 15 g of cobalt powder to the container. 3. Introduce 5 g of technetium powder into the mixture. 4. Finally, add 30 g of tungsten powder. 5. Mix all ingredients thoroughly using a ceramic spatula to ensure a uniform blend.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 20 g of boron powder and place in a clean mixing container. 2. Add 15 g of cobalt powder to the container. 3. Introduce 5 g of technetium powder into the mixture. 4. Finally, add 30 g of tungsten powder. 5. Mix all ingredients thoroughly using a ceramic spatula to ensure a uniform blend.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a graphite crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the furnace gradually to 1200°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for proper fusion of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a graphite crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the furnace gradually to 1200°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for proper fusion of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature, approximately 25°C. 2. This cooling process should take around 4 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool naturally to room temperature, approximately 25°C. 2. This cooling process should take around 4 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant suitable for metal compounds to protect the surface.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges with fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant suitable for metal compounds to protect the surface.
